ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin permanentia, from permanens, present participle of permanere 'to remain, endure', from per- 'through' + manere 'to remain'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one. Here used as an uncountable noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The state or quality of lasting or remaining unchanged indefinitely; the quality of being permanent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 持久性；永恒性；不变性；长久
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The artist tried to capture the permanence of the mountains in his painting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位艺术家试图在他的画作中捕捉群山的永恒性。
